column2: MAINE DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Maine

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. When a vehicle is hydroplaning:
column4: the windshield wipers cannot keep the windshield clear of rain.
column6: the tires lose contact with the road surface.
column8: the spray from large trucks reduces visibility.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 2. When other vehicles are approaching an uncontrolled intersection at approximately the same time, you should:
column4: increase your speed and get through the intersection.
column6: watch for vehicles coming from the right and yield the right-of-way, then proceed when safe.
column8: maintain your speed and proceed through the intersection.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Merging traffic from the right
column8: One-way traffic
column10: Sharp curves ahead

column2: 4. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: increase your speed to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle.
column8: pull over to the side of the road and stop.
column10: slow down until it passes you.

column2: 5. At dawn you should:
column4: drive with your parking lights on.
column6: drive with your emergency flashers on.
column8: turn on your headlights.
column10: avoid turning your vehicle lights on.

column2: 6. To help relieve fatigue on a trip:
column4: drink coffee frequently.
column6: change feet on the gas pedal.
column8: stretch your legs while driving.
column10: stop for a rest every two hours.

column2: 7. When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column8: maintain a constant speed.

column2: 8. Some roadway surfaces are more slippery during certain times or at certain places. Which of the following is more likely to be slippery on cold, wet days?
column4: Asphalt rather than concrete roads.
column8: Roundabouts and traffic circles.

column2: 9. As long as you don’t leave the road, you may legally pass a vehicle on the right:
column4: if you are on a two-lane, two-way road and the other vehicle is turning left.
column8: Never.
column10: when you are turning into a one-way street with no oncoming traffic.

column2: 10. When you are driving, turning your head and looking before changing lanes is:
column4: a good driving habit.
column8: unnecessary, you should use your rearview mirror instead.
column10: prohibited.

column2: 11. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the right lane.
column8: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column10: the lane you’re in.

column2: 12. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: look to the sides of their vehicle to see what is coming.
column6: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.
column8: slowly pass vehicles the vehicles ahead.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic signals ahead
column8: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column10: Don’t park next to the traffic signal

column2: 14. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column6: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column8: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 15. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
column6: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column8: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.

column2: 16. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column6: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column8: To halt the traffic flow.
column10: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 17. ______________ is an unsafe distraction when driving.
column4: Asking a passenger to enter your mapping request into your GPS.
column6: Controlling an emotion before putting the vehicle in gear.
column8: Leaving early to drive to an appointment.
column10: Texting a message on your cell phone.

column2: 18. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
column8: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.

column2: 19. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
column4: 0.15% or more.
column8: any amount.

column2: 20. Broken yellow lines:
column4: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
column6: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
column8: indicate you are in a no passing zone.

column2: 21. Having a drivers license is:
column4: a requirement.
column8: a privilege.

column2: 22. Drivers should always signal when:
column4: pulling into traffic from a parking area or alley.
column8: pulling out of a parking space.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 23. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: No trucks allowed
column8: Trucks under 12,000 lbs. allowed
column10: Hill or downgrade up ahead

column2: 25. __________________ give you right-of-way to make a left turn.
column4: A flashing red light
column8: A green arrow pointing left
column10: A flashing yellow light

column2: 26. Passing is prohibited:
column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column8: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 27. When entering a freeway, you should check traffic by:
column4: using the inside mirror.
column6: using the side mirror and looking over your shoulder.
column8: using both the inside and outside mirrors.

column2: 28. When passing another vehicle, you should return to your lane if:
column4: you can see both headlights in the rearview mirror.
column6: you are at least 25 feet in front of the passed vehicle.
column8: you have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.
column10: you are 100 feet ahead of the vehicle.

column2: 29. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 30. This sign means:
column4: You must stop ahead
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead
column10: No Passing Zone

column2: 31. The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
column4: Amount of Alcohol Drunk (AAD).
column8: Number of Drinks (NOC).

column2: 32. To safely cross a railroad, drivers should:
column4: drive across quickly if a train is approaching, or if it is too close, stop and then back up.
column6: look both ways only if the red light is flashing.
column8: listen and look both ways, then proceed if it is safe to do so.
column10: stop within 10 feet of all railroad crossings.

column2: 33. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column10: turn left into the one-way road.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow
column8: Turn right or left
column10: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 35. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: stop regardless of your direction of travel.
column6: slow down and pass the bus with caution.
column8: stop if you are driving in the same direction.

column2: 36. When driving in rainy weather, you should:
column4: steer off the road.
column8: drive in low gear.

column2: 37. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column4: move to the left lane.
column8: yield.
column10: honk to let them know you’re there.

column2: 38. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to turn on your headlights.
column6: to turn on your windshield wipers.
column8: to reduce your speed.
column10: to look for road edge markings to guide you.

column2: 39. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: Whoever enters the intersection first.
column8: No one.
column10: You.

column2: 40. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: waterplaning.
column8: pavement-planing.
column10: hydroplaning.

column2: 41. When are you allowed to drink alcoholic beverages in a vehicle on a public highway?
column4: As long as you don’t drive.
column8: Only if you ride in the back seat.
column10: Only if you ride in the back of a pick-up truck.

column2: 42. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: Reduced visibility.
column6: The use of headlight is required by law.
column8: Reduced speed.
column10: Driving within the range.

column2: 43. When you reach an intersection with stop signs at all four corners, you must yield the right-of-way to the driver:
column4: on your right.
column8: on your left.

column2: 44. As they approach the top of a hill, drivers should:
column4: keep a steady speed.
column8: speed up slightly.

column2: 45. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column6: Wait for the next green light.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column10: Enter the intersection with caution.

column2: 46. Taking drugs and alcohol together:
column4: is no more dangerous than alcohol by itself.
column6: helps you get rid of the effects of alcohol in your body.
column8: increase the risk of causing a crash.
column10: has no effect on your general driving ability.

column2: 47. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column10: the type of route you are on.

column2: 48. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column8: Do not enter
column10: No turn on red

column2: 49. Distracted driving may be caused by _________ while driving.
column4: using your cell phone
column8: changing the radio
column10: All of the above.

column2: 50. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Drinking coffee.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Exercise.
column10: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 51. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers are not required to stop.
column6: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column8: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column10: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.

column2: 52. This road sign means:
column4: Do not use your brakes in this area
column8: Warning, curves ahead
column10: Warning, intersection ahead

column2: 53. If your vehicle’s right wheels leave the pavement, you should:
column4: take your foot off the gas and when you are slowed down, ease back on the road when it is safe to do so.
column6: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.
column8: build up brake pressure by pumping the brake pedal several times.
column10: immediately come to a complete stop.

column2: 54. This road sign means:
column4: Yield
column8: Do not enter
column10: Stop

column2: 55. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead
column6: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: Sharp right turn
column10: A road joins from the left

column2: 56. When driving on gravel roads:
column4: your tires do not have as much traction.
column6: you should keep your eyes moving.
column8: you should use cruise control to increase traction.

column2: 57. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line

column2: 58. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: activate your stop lights.
column8: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column10: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 59. This sign means:
column4: series of curves ahead.
column6: no turns are allowed on this road.
column8: narrow road ahead.
column10: the road may be slippery when wet.

column2: 60. To enter a gap in traffic while driving on a highway:
column4: watch only the vehicles behind the gap.
column6: check behind, then watch the vehicle ahead.
column8: speed up and let vehicles make way.
